Problem:
Analyze the behavior of a complex-valued function \\( z(t) \\) defined by the differential equation \\( \\dot{z} = iCz \\), where \\( i \\) is the imaginary unit and C is a real constant. The function undergoes an integral transformation \\( T[z](t) = \\int_0^t e^{-iCs}z(s) ds \\).

Assuming the initial condition \\( z(0) = z_0 \\) is transformed by \\( T[z] \\) and then evolved according to \\( \\dot{z} = iCz \\) from time 0 to T, will \\( z(T) \\) match the evolution of \\( z_0 \\) under \\( \\dot{z} = iCz \\) without the transformation?
Explanation: The integral transformation \\( T[z] \\) affects the initial phase and amplitude of the function \\( z(t) \\). Since it integrates over a path affected by \\( e^{-iCs} \\), the resultant state at any t including T will not match the direct evolution from \\( z_0 \\) under \\( \\dot{z} = iCz \\).
